bibl.title: Inspection Report from J. C. McKee to the Surgeon General, 1877

div1.p: McKee reports to the Surgeon General that Reed has his hospital in “most excellent condition.” He also mentions Reed's personal qualities that have won him the confidence of all. [Courtesy of the National Archives and Records Administration]

div1.head: Inspection Report from J. C. McKee to the Surgeon General, 1877
div1.p:
2086 S.G.O.-1877- Inspection Report: med. Div. J. C. McKee
Dept. Arizona

Camp Lowell A.T.. . . “Asst. Surgeon Walter Reed
U.S. Army, in charge - has, I am pleased to say, his
hospital in most excellent condition, as the above
report shows. He is of unexceptionable habits, studious,
careful and conscientious in the discharge of his
duty, having the respect and confidence of the
officers, their families and enlisted men”...

THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES OF THE UNITED STATES * 1934 *
OFFICER
SCRIPTA
MANET

THE NATIONAL ARCHIVES
Washington, D. C.

RECORDS OF THE WAR DEPARTMENT, Office of the Surgeon
General, Register of Medical Officers, Vol. 6.
